main event: A sighting of a bright white object or balloon in Victoria, Texas on 3 Feb 53, documented by the U.S. Air Force's Project Blue Book.
interesting points: The sighting occurred in broad daylight and the object was described as slowly moving with no discernible features other than the sun reflecting off it.
The observer, a service station operator, stopped the observation after about 30 minutes when he got busy at his station.
The description of the course of the object indicated that it glided slowly across the sky and disappeared with an azimuth of about 320 degrees.
Weather conditions at the time of the sighting included clear ceiling, 15 miles visibility, and cirrus cloud cover from northeast and east, with no thunderstorms in the area.
The Wing Intelligence Officer suggested that the sighting may have possibly been a weather balloon released by a weather station in the vicinity.
